content: Experimental Procedures. In a typical synthetic procedure, 0.220 g of Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O, 0.105 g of H3btc, 0.096 g of 4,4‘-bipy·2H2O for 1 or 0.194 g of pipe·6H2O for 2, 2 mL of 1-butanol, and 3 mL of H2O were first mixed. Each of the reaction mixtures was sealed in a Teflon-lined steel autoclave and allowed to crystallize at 160 °C for 120 h. Colorless product crystals were washed with deionized water, filtered, and dried in air at room temperature. The compositions were identified by elemental analyses. Anal:  Calc. for 1 C28H16N2O14Zn4:  C, 38.84; H, 1.86; N, 3.24; Zn, 30.21%. Found:  C, 38.71; H, 1.95; N, 3.34; Zn, 30.12. Anal:  Calc. for 2 C13H14N2O7Zn2:  C, 35.41; H, 3.20; N, 6.35; Zn, 29.66%. Found:  C, 34.32; H, 3.25; N, 6.42; Zn, 29.54.
clean_text: Experimental Procedures. In a typical synthetic procedure, 0.220 g of Zn(CH3COO)2⋅2H2O, 0.105 g of H3btc, 0.096 g of 4,4‘-bipy⋅2H2O for 1 or 0.194 g of pipe⋅6H2O for 2, 2 mL of 1-butanol, and 3 mL of H2O were first mixed. Each of the reaction mixtures was sealed in a Teflon-lined steel autoclave and allowed to crystallize at 160 °C for 120 h. Colorless product crystals were washed with deionized water, filtered, and dried in air at room temperature. The compositions were identified by elemental analyses. Anal: Calc. for 1 C28H16N2O14Zn4: C, 38.84; H, 1.86; N, 3.24; Zn, 30.21%. Found: C, 38.71; H, 1.95; N, 3.34; Zn, 30.12. Anal: Calc. for 2 C13H14N2O7Zn2: C, 35.41; H, 3.20; N, 6.35; Zn, 29.66%. Found: C, 34.32; H, 3.25; N, 6.42; Zn, 29.54.
